p: miR-34b-5p was detected to have a higher expression in the serum of septic patients with AKI ( Figure 1(A), p < 0.01, compared to the normal group). The serum levels of TNF-α, IL-1β, IL-6, SCr, and BUN were also up-regulated in patients with septic AKI in comparison with the normal group ( Figure 1(B–F), p < 0.01). Moreover, the Pearson correlation coefficients showed that the expression of miR-34b-5p was positively correlated with that of TNF-α, IL-1β, IL-6, SCr, and BUN in the patients with septic AKI ( Figure 1(G–K), p < 0.05).
